explanation: Agent A is correct. The for loop in send_all uses off as the loop counter and has the update expression off += (size_t) ret. The object ret is assigned inside the loop body (ret = send(...), and ret is also written in the EAGAIN handling), so the third clause of the for statement uses an object that is modified in the loop body. That violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 (the third clause shall modify only the loop counter and shall not use objects modified in the loop body; also only one loop counter is allowed). The reported violation is valid.
